a.g: Ha, Meem.
The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
Indeed, within the heavens and earth are signs for the believers.
And in the creation of yourselves and what He disperses of moving creatures are signs for people who are certain [in faith].

And [in] the alternation of night and day and [in] what Allah sends down from the sky of provision and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and [in His] directing of the winds are signs for a people who reason.
These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth. Then in what statement after Allah and His verses will they believe?
Woe to every sinful liar
Who hears the verses of Allah recited to him, then persists arrogantly as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.
And when he knows anything of Our verses, he takes them in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.
Before them is Hell, and what they had earned will not avail them at all nor what they had taken besides Allah as allies. And they will have a great punishment.
This [Qur'an] is guidance. And those who have disbelieved in the verses of their Lord will have a painful punishment of foul nature.
It is Allah who subjected to you the sea so that ships may sail upon it by His command and that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth - all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
And as for the tree [shajar], indeed Allah, the Exalted, created it and created for it roots, and He channeled water to it, and He created within it the power of nourishment [quwwat al-ightidha'] and growth [numuww] so that it may reach the limit of its maturity [munta nashwati-hi], and thus His servants may benefit from it. So to break it before the limit of its maturity, not in a manner by which His servants may benefit, is a contravention of the intended wisdom [maqsud al-hikmah] and a deviation from justice [al-'adl]. For if one has a sound purpose [gharad sahih], then that is permissible for him, since the tree and the animal were made a ransom [fida'] for the purposes of man. For they are both perishable, destined for ruin. So the perishing of the baser for the survival of the nobler for a period is closer to justice than wasting them both. And to this is the allusion in His, the Exalted's, saying: "And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, all from Him." [45:13]. Yes, if one breaks that which is the property [mulk] of another, then he is also an oppressor [zalim], even if he is in need. For every single tree does not suffice for the needs of all the servants of Allah, but suffices for a single need. And if one person were to claim exclusive right to it without any preponderant reason [tarjihan] or specific claim [ikhtisas], it would be injustice. So the one with the specific claim is he who obtained the seed and placed it in the earth and channeled water to it and undertook its care; he is more entitled to it than others, and his claim is thereby established. If it grew in barren land [mawat al-ard] without human effort, then the claim belongs to the one who planted it or to the one who sowed it. Otherwise, another specific claim must be sought, and that is precedence in taking it [al-sabuq ila akhdhi-hi]; for the one who is first has the specific quality of precedence. So justice is that he be the most entitled to it. And the poor have expressed this preponderance as ownership [mulk], and this is purely metaphorical [majaz mahd], for there is no ownership except for the King of Kings [Malik al-Muluk] to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth. How can a servant be an owner when he himself does not own his own self, but is rather owned by another? Indeed, creation are the servants of Allah, and the earth is the table [ma'idah] of Allah, and He has permitted them to eat from His table according to their need, like a king who sets a table for his servants. So if one takes a morsel with his right hand and encloses it within his fist, and another servant comes and wishes to snatch it from his hand, he cannot be allowed to do soâ€”not because the morsel has become his property by taking it with the hand, for the hand and the owner of the hand are also ownedâ€”but because each specific morsel does not suffice for the need of every servant. So justice in allocation lies in the occurrence of some form of preponderance and specific claim. The taking establishes a specific claim by which the servant is singled out, and thus one who cannot present such a claim is prevented from competing with him. This is how you should understand the command of Allah concerning His servants. And for this reason We say: Whoever takes from the wealth of the world [amwal al-dunya] more than his need and hoards it and withholds it, while among the servants of Allah are those who are in need of it, he is an oppressor, and he is among those who hoard gold and silver and do not spend it in the way of Allah [sabil Allah]. And the way of Allah is obedience to Him, and the provision for creation in His obedience is the wealth of the world, for by it their necessities are repelled and their needs are lifted.

a.g: Say, [O Muhammad], to those who have believed that they [should] forgive those who expect not the days of Allah so that He may recompense a people for what they used to earn.
Whoever does a good deed - it is for himself; and whoever does evil - it is against the self. Then to your Lord you will be returned.
And We did certainly give the Children of Israel the Scripture and judgement and prophethood, and We provided them with good things and preferred them over the worlds.

And We gave them clear proofs of the matter [of religion]. And they did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
Then We put you, [O Muhammad], on an ordained way concerning the matter [of religion]; so follow it and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know.
Indeed, they will never avail you against Allah at all. And indeed, the wrongdoers are allies of one another; but Allah is the protector of the righteous.
This [Qur'an] is enlightenment for mankind and guidance and mercy for a people who are certain [in faith].
Or do those who commit evils think We will make them like those who have believed and done righteous deeds - [make them] equal in their life and their death? Evil is that which they judge.

And he who follows his caprice [hawa] departs from this Oneness [tawhid], for every follower of his caprice has taken his caprice as his god. Allah, the Exalted, says: "Have you seen him who has taken his caprice [hawa] as his god?" (Al-Jathiyah: 23). a.g: And they say, "There is not but our worldly life; we die and live, and nothing destroys us except time." And they have of that no knowledge; they are only assuming.
And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, their argument is only that they say, "Bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful."
Say, "Allah causes you to live, then causes you to die; then He will assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt, but most of the people do not know."
And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And the Day the Hour appears - that Day the falsifiers will lose.
And you will see every nation kneeling [from fear]. Every nation will be called to its record [and told], "Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do.

Indeed, when the call of the Almighty [al-JabbÄr], majestic is His majesty, strikes your hearing: **"Today, every soul [nafs] will be recompensed for what it earned. No injustice today!"** â€” then, at that moment, your heart [qalb] is rent asunder from awe [hayba], and your soul [nafs] becomes certain [tuqinu] of perdition [al-bawÄr]. And you remember what God, exalted is He, warned you through the tongue of His Messenger, where He said: (They said: "O Messenger of God, will we see our Lord on the Day of Resurrection?" He said: "Do you have any difficulty in seeing the sun at midday when there is no cloud obscuring it?" They said: "No." He said: "Do you have any difficulty in seeing the full moon on a clear night when there is no cloud obscuring it?" They said: "No." He said: "Then, by the One in Whose hand is my soul [nafs], you will have no more difficulty in seeing your Lord. Then the servant will be cast forth, and He will say to him: 'Did I not honor you, make you master, give you spouses, subjugate for you horses and camels, and let you lead and live in comfort?' The servant will say: 'Yes.' He will say: 'Did you think you would meet Me?' He will say: 'No.' He will say: 'Then I will forget you as you forgot Me.'") So imagine yourself, O wretched one, when the angels have taken you by your arms and you are standing before God, exalted is He, and He questions you directly, saying to you: "Did I not bestow upon you youth? In what did you expend it? Did I not grant you respite in your lifespan? In what did you waste it? Did I not provide you with wealth? From where did you acquire it, and in what did you spend it? Did I not honor you with knowledge ['ilm]? What did you act upon from what you knew?" How then do you see your shame and your disgrace, as He enumerates for you His blessings [in'Äm] and your acts of disobedience [ma'Äá¹£Ä«], His favors [ayÄdÄ«] and your misdeeds [masÄwÄ«]? a.g: So as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is what is the clear attainment.
But as for those who disbelieved, [it will be said], "Were not Our verses recited to you, but you were arrogant and became a people of criminals?

And when it was said, 'Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth and the Hour [is coming] - no doubt about it,' you said, 'We know not what is the Hour. We assume only assumption, and we are not convinced.' "
And the evil consequences of what they did will appear to them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
And it will be said, "Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours, and your refuge is the Fire, and for you there are no helpers.
That is because you took the verses of Allah in ridicule, and worldly life deluded you." So that Day they will not be removed from it, nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].
Then, to Allah belongs [all] praise - Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.
And to Him belongs [all] grandeur within the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
